  • Field Details

    • SEARCH_BY_SERIAL_NUMBER

      public final char SEARCH_BY_SERIAL_NUMBER
      A magic character used to determine which branch of the program to execute. Using this char causes one otherwise identically named constructors to be used. It could be anything, as long as the logic checks for whatever value is assigned to it.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • SEARCH_BY_TOY_NAME

      public final char SEARCH_BY_TOY_NAME
      A magic character used to determine which branch of the program to execute. Using this char causes one otherwise identically named constructors to be used. It could be anything, as long as the logic checks for whatever value is assigned to it.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • DEFAULT_FILENAME

      public final String DEFAULT_FILENAME
      The default filename to use. This filename is used when the application is running inside the Eclipse console, and when it has not been exported to a runnable JAR.
      See Also:
      • Constant Field Values

    • records

      private ArrayList<Toy> records
      The toylist which will hold the toys for the whole program. This is the in-memory database.

  • Constructor Details

    • Database

      public Database()
      Instantiate the database by reading it from disk.

    • Database

      public Database(String filename)
      Instatiate a database from an arbitrary file form disk.
      Parameters:
      filename - The path and name of the filename to create a database from.

  • Method Details

    • searchRecords

      public ArrayList<Toy> searchRecords(String query, char searchMethod)
      Search the database records for a name matching the given string (using the String.contains() method) or an exact serial number.
      Parameters:
      query - The query for the database, a String, which is either toy's serial number or string to be matched against the toy's name.
      searchMethod - a character indicating whether the method to use is the serial number or name search methodology, either 's' or 'n'.
      Returns:
      searchResult An arraylist of toys that include the toys following the provided search method

    • searchRecords

      public ArrayList<Toy> searchRecords(int age)
      Search the database records for toys with a given minimum age recommendation.
      Parameters:
      age - The minimum age requirement of the toy, in years.
      Returns:
      searchResult The arraylist of toys that are searched through the appropriate age field

    • searchRecords

      public ArrayList<Toy> searchRecords(char query)
      Search the database records for toys of a particular type.
      Parameters:
      query - The type of toy to search for, one of 'a', 'b', 'f', or 'p'.
      Returns:
      toylist The toy list containing all the toys that came from the search method

    • addRecord

      public void addRecord(Toy newToy)
      Adds a new toy to the database.
      Parameters:
      newToy - a toy of any type.

    • removeRecord

      public void removeRecord(Toy existingToy)
      Removes an existing toy from the database
      Parameters:
      existingToy - a toy from the list

    • purchaseToy

      public void purchaseToy(Toy toy)
      Purchases a toy from the database, decrementing it's available count if the count is one or more.
      Parameters:
      toy - The toy that we are trying to buy

    • toyListFromFile

      private ArrayList<Toy> toyListFromFile(String filename)
      Method to create and return an arraylist from a file
      Parameters:
      filename - The input file containing the toylist on disk
      Returns:
      toyList The arraylist of toys

    • toyListToFile

      private void toyListToFile(ArrayList<Toy> toyList, String filename)
      Method to append the toylist to the file
      Parameters:
      toyList - The toy list that is being added to the file
      filename - The file that the toy list is being added to

    • writeToDisk

      public void writeToDisk(String filename)
      Write the in-memory database back to disk, overwriting any database file that exists (as on-disk data would be out of date).
      Parameters:
      filename - The filename that the database will be written to.
